axioms.name: Foundational Axiom
axioms.statement: Film is dream, film is music. The cinema operates through affective logic rather than rational argument. Like dreams, it bypasses linguistic mediation to access emotional truth directly. Like music, it structures time as felt duration rather than measured sequence.
derivations: Cinema permits direct transmission of psychological states through visual rhythm and composition
Fundamental departure from theatrical realism despite deep roots in stage practice

axioms.name: The Face Contains All Drama
axioms.statement: The human face is the great subject of the cinema. Everything can be read in the face. The close-up is not merely a technique but an ontological claim: the face is the primary site where interiority becomes visible. Unlike landscape or architecture, the face cannot dissemble completely - micro-expressions betray what words conceal.
derivations: Face as primary site of visible interiority

axioms.name: Intimacy Requires Constraint
axioms.statement: Dramatic intensity varies inversely with spatial and numerical expansion. The fewer the characters and the more confined the space, the greater the potential for psychological excavation.
derivations: Formal constraints intensify rather than limit dramatic possibilities

axioms.name: Demons Must Be Named to Be Expelled
axioms.statement: One must make films about things one knows, about what hurts. The only way to get rid of one's demons is to portray them. Art as exorcism: the therapeutic function of creative work operates through confrontation and articulation rather than avoidance.
derivations: Naming psychological forces transforms them from possessing agents into represented objects

axioms.name: Silence Is the Presence of Absence
axioms.statement: God's silence is not neutral emptiness but active withdrawal. The unanswered prayer creates meaning through its very failure.
derivations: Kenotic silence - an emptying that demands response

axioms.name: The Mask Reveals the Face
axioms.statement: The persona (social mask) and the authentic self exist in productive tension. Stripping away pretense does not reveal a stable identity but another layer of performance, unto the void.
derivations: No stable authentic self beneath performance

levels.name: Spatial Compression
levels.description: Physical containment that creates psychological entrapment

levels.name: Temporal Concentration
levels.description: Compressed duration that maintains dramatic pressure
elements: Compressed Duration (hours to days, not years)

levels.name: Relational Minimalism
levels.description: Minimal cast for maximum psychological intensity

levels.name: Thematic Intensification
levels.description: Existential themes that drive psychological excavation
elements: Identity Crisis (who am I without my mask?)

core_algorithms.name: Chamber Drama Construction
core_algorithms.purpose: Generates dramatic structure through systematic constraint, derived from Strindberg's kammarspel principles
core_algorithms.pseudocode: SELECT isolated_space WHERE exit_difficulty >= HIGH AND scale == DOMESTIC; CREATE essential_dyad; IF needs_catalyst THEN add_third_party; IF needs_witness THEN add_observer; ASSERT character_count <= 4; COMPRESS timeframe; ENTER at crisis_moment; ESTABLISH existential_stakes(death_proximity, god_question, identity_threat)

core_algorithms.name: Facial Excavation Protocol
core_algorithms.purpose: The Bergman-Nykvist close-up methodology - the face as landscape of the soul
core_algorithms.pseudocode: BEGIN with social_distance; WHILE emotional_pressure.increasing DO reduce_focal_distance AND eliminate_context; WHEN mask_begins_to_crack ENTER extreme_close_up; APPLY soft_diffused_lighting; HOLD longer_than_comfortable; DETERMINE gaze_direction (direct_to_camera | averted | to_other_character); RETURN revelations_captured

core_algorithms.name: Silence Treatment (Bergman Mode)
core_algorithms.purpose: Deploy silence as absence, withdrawal, and accusation - contrasting with Tarkovsky's plenum-silence
core_algorithms.pseudocode: SELECT silence_type FROM (DIVINE, ELECTIVE, TRAUMATIC, ACCUSATORY, EXHAUSTED); ESTABLISH expectation_of_speech; DEPLOY selected_silence WITH appropriate_meaning; IF others_present THEN response = (CONFESSION | PROJECTION | BREAKDOWN | MIRROR); RETURN silence_deployment WHERE duration = until_unbearable

core_algorithms.name: The Merged Face Sequence
core_algorithms.purpose: Identity dissolution through visual superimposition - the Persona technique of two faces becoming one
core_algorithms.pseudocode: ASSERT relationship.intimacy >= INTENSE AND power_dynamic == ASYMMETRICAL; ACCUMULATE visual_rhymes throughout_film; WHEN identity_confrontation THEN EXECUTE split_screen_composite; CREATE impossible_third_face from left_half_A + right_half_B; HOLD for recognition THEN horror THEN self_questioning; RETURN merged_sequence WHERE psychological_meaning = identity_dissolution

core_algorithms.name: The Bergman Confession
core_algorithms.purpose: The extended monologue as psychological strip-tease - one speaker, one silent listener, progressive revelation
core_algorithms.pseudocode: REQUIRE one_speaker AND one_silent_listener AND extended_duration(5-15min); ESTABLISH confessor_reluctance; DELIVER content_layers PROGRESSIVELY (surface_narrative, emotional_truth, shameful_secret, core_wound); INTERCUT with listener_face; APPROACH with gradual_close_up; AT climax DELIVER the_unspeakable; RETURN response FROM (SILENCE, REJECTION, EMBRACE, COUNTER_CONFESSION)

core_algorithms.name: Theatrical-Cinematic Hybridization
core_algorithms.purpose: Bergman's unique synthesis retaining theatrical intensity while exploiting cinematic intimacy
core_algorithms.pseudocode: RETAIN theatrical_elements (verbal_density, spatial_unity, performative_intensity, dramatic_structure); TRANSFORM FOR cinema (face_replaces_body, whispers_replace_projection, micro_gestures, natural_lighting); SYNTHESIZE bergman_inventions (film_within_film, stage_within_film, rehearsal_as_revelation, direct_address); RETURN hybrid_form WHERE intensity = THEATRICAL AND intimacy = CINEMATIC

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the space sufficiently constrained? Can characters easily leave?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Characters cannot easily leave; architecture creates psychological pressure; threshold spaces mark inside/outside

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the cast minimally essential? Could any character be removed without destroying the drama?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: No character can be removed; clear dyadic core exists; each additional character serves irreplaceable function

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the temporal pressure adequate? Does the drama enter at crisis point?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Drama enters at crisis point; urgency exists beyond plot mechanics; death (literal or metaphorical) hovers

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the face being used as landscape? Are close-ups held long enough to reveal layers?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Close-ups held long enough for revelation; lighting serves revelation; face shows what words cannot say

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the mask-face dialectic operative? Can we see the effort of performance?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Effort of performance is visible; moments exist when mask slips; there is a face beneath the face

diagnostic_questions.question: Is silence functioning as presence? Does silence create meaning through absence?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Silence creates meaning through absence; unanswered speech is more powerful than answer; silence shifts power dynamics

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the confession sequence structured for maximum exposure?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Reluctance is overcome; progressive revelation occurs; unspeakable core is finally spoken

diagnostic_questions.question: Are identity boundaries appropriately unstable?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: Characters project onto each other; moments of fusion/confusion exist; unclear where one psyche ends and another begins

diagnostic_questions.question: Is the existential confrontation genuine?
diagnostic_questions.valid_if: God's silence is addressed; death's presence is felt; question of meaning is at stake

maps_to: Levinas - The Face of the Other

core_operations: SPACE: Compress until escape is impossible
CAST: Reduce until each presence is essential
TIME: Enter at crisis, maintain pressure
FACE: The primary text - read it obsessively
IDENTITY: Masks beneath masks unto void
DEATH: The uninvited guest always present
CINEMA: The intimacy theater cannot achieve
key_constraints: Spatial compression - isolated locations with limited exit points
Cast minimalism - 2-4 principal characters with dyadic core
Temporal concentration - compressed duration entering at crisis
Facial primacy - close-up as primary dramatic unit
Existential stakes - death and God's silence as constants
